10005-d-01-15-10-ARR.Narrative: ON JANUARY 15, 2010 AT 9:30 PM AST. NORTHBOUND ALASKA RAILROAD (ARR) EMPTY COAL TRAIN 181N DERAILEDTWO EMPTY CARS AT MP 54.61 IN THE PLACER BLOCK.  THE MAXIMUM AUTHORIZER SPEED IN 49 MPH.  THE TRAINWAS OPERATING AT 34 MPH AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO THE CREW MEMBERS OR HAZARDOUS MATERIALS RELEASED. CREW NOW HAD A TOTAL OF 118 CARS AND AN EASTWARD MOVEMENT WAS INITIATED; THE64TH CAR FROM LOCOMOTIVE CSXT 830377 (WEST TRUCK) STARTED EAST DOWN #1 DEXTER (DUE TO DAMAGED SWITCH) HAULING 54 CARS BEHIND IT, AS THE EAST TRUCK OF CSXT 830377 TRAVELED EAST ON THE DEXTER LEAD.  CREW WAS UNAWARE OF THIS SITUATION.  WHEN THE CREW SHOVED WEST TO DEPART, TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  ATOTAL OF 12 CARS WERE FOUND DERAILED.  CARS DERAILED:  CSXT 830177, 812306, 830377, 832854, 349074,819824, 822619, 832566, HLMX 87612, CSXT 832564, 811076 AND URR 2345.  CREW WAS D&A TESTED UNDER COMPANY REASON CAUSE TESTING AUTHORITY.

I0110-d-01-03-10-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0110-d-01-03-10-PATH.Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0110-d-01-03-10-PATH.Narrative: AT 1636 HOURS ON SUNDAY, JANUARY 3, 2010, A ONE-CAR TRAIN WAS BEING MOVED ONTO TRACK 14.  THE TRAINWAS BEING OPERATED FROM THE CAB OF CAR 882 BY ENGINEER PILLA.  AS THE TRAIN MOVED ONTO TRACK 14, THENO. 1 END OF CAR 882 HAD A HARD-ADD WITH THE NO. 2 END OF STANDING CAR 147.  THE CARS SUSTAINED UNDERCARRIAGE AND CARBODY DAMAGE AS A RESULT OF THE INCIDENT.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS INCIDENT.  THE CARS INVOLVED WERE SCHEDULED FOR INSPECTION.  ACCORDING TO TRAINMASTER REPORT 33099, THE ENGINEER REPORTED THAT THE BRAKES FAILED TO APPLY ON CAR 882.  THE CAR WOULD NOT STOP WHEN HE ACTIVATED THE EMERGENCY BRAKE.  THE CARS INVOLVED IN THE INCIDENT WERE INSPECTED.  THE BRAKING SYSTEM ON CAR 882 WAS INSPECTED.  THE INSPECTION REVEALED THAT CONDENSATION ACCUMULATED IN THE AIR BRAKE SYSTEM LINES OF CAR 882.  IT FROZE IN SUB-FREEZING TERMPERATURES.  THIS RESULTED IN THE FREEZING OF THE 'N4E' APPLICATION/RELEASE MAGNET VALVE ON THE CAR, AND BRAKING SYSTEM AS A WHOLE.  THIS CONDITION ATTTRIBUTED TO THE BRAKING SYSTEM FAILURE ON THE CAR.

0110CB028-d-01-21-10-UP.Narrative: KG1LT-21 COLLIDED WITH HULCHER SIDE BOOM, WHICH WAS WORKING IN YARD TO RERAIL A LOCOMOTIVE.  CONTRACTOR DIDN'T HAVE MAINLINE PROTECTION, HOWEVER WAS TOLD BY UPRR MECHANICAL PERSONNEL THEY WOULDN'T FOUL THE MAINLINE WHEN SETTING UP SIDE BOOM ON SOUTH SIDE OF YARD LEAD, BETWEEN LEAD AND MAINLINE 1.  SIDE BOOM WAS GETTING INTO POSITION TO RERAIL LOCOMOTIVE, WHEN IT FOULED MAINLINE 1.  KG1LT-21 WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON MAINLINE 1 WHEN IT STRUCK SIDE BOOM ON ENGINEER'S SIDE.  LEAD TWO LOCOMOTIVES AND 23 WELLS BEHIND DERAILED.  CONTRACTOR WAS IN SIDE BOOM AT TIME OF IMPACT AND WAS TRANSPORTED BY AMBULANCE TO HOSPITAL FOR NON LIFE THREATENING INJURIES.  CREW OF TRAIN WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL BY UPRRPERSONNEL TO RECEIVE TREATMENT PER INHALATION PROTOCOL.  CAUSE CODE H999 USED DUE TO FOREMAN GENERAL ALLOWED HULCHER EQUIPMENT TO SET UP AND START RERAILING OPERATIONS BEFORE PROTECTION FOR THE LOCATION WAS OBTAINED.  HULCHER EQUIPMENT FOULED NO. 1 MAIN.  RAIL = CWR

SCSMGA001-d-01-21-10-SCS.Narrative: WHERE IT OCCURRED - MP F72 - MADISON GA. ON 1-21-10 I WAS ENGINEER ON SOUTHBOUND TRAIN LEAVING MADISON GA. WITH ONE ENGINE SCS 8795, AND SIXTEEN CARS.  I WAS TRAVELING AT 8 MPH WHEN I MADE A 10 POUNDBRAKE PIPE REDUCTION.  THE TRAIN CAME TO A QUICK STOP.  THERE WAS NO TUGGING FROM THE CARS BEHIND US, AND THE AMP METER WAS NOT DOING ANYTHING UNUSUAL.  THE CONDUCTOR TIED DOWN THE TRAIN, THEN WE BOTHWALKED ON INSPECTED THE TRAIN TO DISCOVER THAT THE BOTTOM TWO CARS HAD DERAILED.  ON 1-21-10 I WASCONDUCTOR ON THE SOUTHBOUND TRAIN LEAVING MADISON GA WITH 16 CARS 2 LOADED 14 EMPTIES.  AT MILE POST72 IN A DOWN HILL CURVE I HEARD THE ENGINEER MAKE A BRAKE REDUCTION AND SOON AFTER THE TRAIN MADE AQUICK STOP I TIED 4 BRAKES AND THE ENGINEER AND I WALKED THE TRAIN AND FOUND THE BOTTOM 2 CARS ON THE GROUND

000072435-d-01-26-10-CSX.Primary Accident Cause: Interference (other than vandalism) with railroad operations by nonrailroad employee
000072435-d-01-26-10-CSX.Accident Cause: Interference (other than vandalism) with railroad operations by nonrailroad employee
000072435-d-01-26-10-CSX.Narrative: THE CREW ON THE T10418 WAS CALLED TO SPOT A LOAD AND PULL AN EMPTY TRAIN FROM SEMINOLE ELECTRIC.  THE CREW PULLED THE LOADED TRAIN INTO THE INBOUND TRACK, TESTED THE HANDBRAKES, AND CUT AWAY FROM THEIR TRAIN.  THEY THEN COUPLED TO THE EMPTY TRAIN ON THE MIDDLE TRACK.  ON ARRIVAL, THE CREW WAS NOTIFIED THEY NEED TO SET THE REAR CAR OUT TO THE J SPUR.  THE ROTARY COUPLER ON THIS CAR WAS ON THE WRONGEND TO DUMP THE CAR.  THE CREW PULLED THE EMPTY TRAIN AHEAD APPROXIMATELY 40 CARS TO CLEAR THE J SPUR.  THEY THEN SHOVED APPROXIMATELY SIX CAR LENGTHS ONTO THE SPUR TO SPOT THE CAR, WITH PERMISSION FROM THE SEMINOLE ELECTRIC EMPLOYEES.  THE CREW TIED AND TESTED THE HANDBRAKE ON THIS CAR, CUT AWAY,AND BEGAN TO PULL OUT OF THE SPUR WHEN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT REVEALEDON THE PREVIOUS DAY, THE SEMINOLE ELECTRIC CREW FAILED TO CHECK THE POSITION OF THE NUMBER 4 SWITCHBEFORE DUMPING OPERATIONS BEGAN, RUNNING THROUGH THE SWITCH.  ADDITIONALLY, THE INBOUND CSX CREW COULD NOT SEE THE POSITION OF THE SWITCH OR TARGET DUE TO THE EMPTY TRAIN SITTING ON THE SWITCH.  WHENTHE CSX CREW SHOVED THE EMPTY TRAIN BACK INTO THE J SPUR, THE SWITCH SPLIT, DERAILING THE CARS.
